context: The Estonian word 'rong' primarily means a railway train consisting of a locomotive (motor or electric vehicle) and one or more coupled carriages used for transporting passengers or cargo. It can also refer metaphorically to a procession or line of people, vehicles, or objects moving in sequence. The word follows regular Estonian declension patterns with forms like 'rongi' (genitive), 'rongid' (plural nominative), and 'rongiga' (comitative/with).
